scenarioDescription:
The MOA-bin-1L Exoplanetary System


Overview

MOA-bin-1L is a star with 0.75 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 16633.96 light years away from the solar system.

MOA-bin-1L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the MOA-bin-1L system


MOA-bin-1L b

MOA-bin-1L b was discovered by the MOA observatory, in 2012-10, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 8.30 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of MOA-bin-1L b is 1176.600 times the mass of Earth. The radius of MOA-bin-1L b is 13.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, MOA-bin-1L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system MOA-bin-1L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the MOA.
name: MOA-bin-1L - System With 1 Exoplanet
